    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick(int i,
        int j,
        int k)
        Description copied from class: Gui
        Ticks this element. All game logic should go in tick() - in other words anything that depends on running the same on all systems, regardless of how fast the user's system is.
        Specified by:
        tick in class Gui
        Parameters:
        i - X-position of the mouse
        j - Y-position of the mouse
        k - Button state of the mouse (0 = no buttons pressed, 1 = left mouse button is down, 2 = right button is down)

      • shouldDelete

        public boolean shouldDelete()

      • render

        public void render(float interpolation)
        Description copied from class: Gui
        All rendering should go here. Since rendering happens much faster than ticking, an interpolation value must be used. This is how far in between the previous tick and the next tick this render was called.
        Specified by:
        render in class Gui
        Parameters:
        interpolation - How far in between this tick and the next tick we are (0.0-1.0)

        public boolean hasShown()
